Reviews.Title: “Toilet With A Transparent Door --> not a honeymoon trend!”
Reviews.Author: Lesya L
Reviews.Content: There are few pearls of this hotel like: great location, extremely friendly staff, ultra modern design, spacious rooms and even a TV in the toilet, like you REALLY need one ;)  There are weak sides of The Mirror Barcelona such as: small swimming pool, jerky Internet (a night mare for a business person). And the last and not least - a TRANSPARENT door of the TOILET in the room! And if you are a honeymoon couple - that could be a deal breaker as you can imagine how NOT romantically "a TRANSPARENT door of the TOILET in the room" sounds. But if you have a great sense of humour and ready to spend considerable amount of money putting yourself in a slightly uncomfortable position - suit yourself!  Personally, I would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate in design and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location if you want to be away from the noisy centre, it was 5 minutes away from two metros. We were there with a two year old, and found the room (superior) with the veranda very toddler friendly. Although in the same room, the cot was placed in a concealed area of the room, which allowed us to stay watching TV or reading in bed without disturbing the little one. The staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly for giving us local information. One regret is that we were really hoping to eat in what looked like a fabulous restaurant, with very dedicated cooks; but it was closed on Sundays and Mondays. Indeed in the restaurant/breakfast room they had a very good stockpile of wines, and most of all a very good variety of Single Malts! Lovely big glass of Sangria in the veranda for Euro 8, given that we could not go out in the evening. Will definately go next time!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dai16
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in a standard de luxe room. First impressions were good with friendly reception staff and this continued throughout our stay with the offer to look after our bags after check out. Our room was modern all in white with mirrors everywhere, quite small but the available space was well used. Toilet and shower were not as private as we would have liked personally. We only had breakfast once due to the cost of 46 euros for two. The hotel is in a prosperous area close to the city centre surrounded by good restaurants and bars. We were able to walk to many of the main attractions from the hotel. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Vanity rules”
Reviews.Author: TFOPB
Reviews.Content: If you like seeing yourself from all angles then this is the place for you. Great design, superb beds and sumptuous soft cushions. Loved it, and very convenient for Barcelona centre, only 15 min walk, but far enough out to get value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine1962
Reviews.Content: We were not disappointed on arrival, staff helpful & informative. We had a deluxe room with a small balcony, very comfortable bed & pillows. The location was great for everything and we had no noise so got a good nights sleep for the five day vacation. This was our first visit and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous design but not quite 4 star service”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth58
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based upon Jetsetter feature and price. The hotel design is stunning and very futuristic especially upon first arrival and trying to figure out how to get into room. It is truly all white. The glass doors for the shower and toilet will make some who like more privacy uncomfortable. The service is brisk (as someone else said here are two maps-go). One tapas restaurant recommendation was top notch. Daily room cleaning was definitely uneven-dirty glasses remaining some days, toilet paper not refilled. Location is good as it is just minutes from Passeig de Gracia. I would likely try another hotel when next in Barcelona given the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch locale near shopping streets and nightlife”
Reviews.Author: TuomLapv
Reviews.Content: As my usual place in Barcelona was closed for renovations (Hilton av Diagonal) I decided to try something else. Booked the hotel from ba.com and the had this name as the top recommendation. And it is easy to see why. Uncongested lobby and very helpful and competent staff there, excellent selection of Catalan wines (and also wines from elsewehere) in the lobby bar and restaurant, and the restaurant prices were reasonable. It took some figuring out to get to the room doors operating with smart card and the doornumbers being located on the floor in front of the door. The basic room was handy otherwise but bathtub was quite difficult to access, having to climb over the edge over half a meter. Lights in the room were handy and switches were by to bed. An LCD-TV in front of the bed measured 40 inches and there was another LCD-TV in the loo. Have to sample later larger and even better equipped rooms. Housekeeping was ok but if you wanted to sleep until late, there began some noises from the corridors caused by the roomkeeping around after 9 AM. Noise insulation between the rooms appeared adequate and practically no traffic noises could be heard in a room facing the inside of the block. All in all a very pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “If you like white, this is the right place”
Reviews.Author: tewmike
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the check-in was good as we arrived quite early and they made our room ready earlier than normal. The receptionist was clear and helpful by even giving some tips on what is nearby (like metro, restaurants, etc...). The room, which was a Privilege Room was fine but realised that we had to compromise on the space to have the terrace. A standard room is bigger. So it depends what you are looking for: room space or outdoor space. The room itself was quirky, white and full of mirrors. If you like your privacy, please note that there is no door between the bed and the bathroom sink. Also the toilet is just next to the bed and without a lock. The same for the shower with the difference that you can see through the shower door. The breakfast was nice with a good variety with the plus of being able to order warm food. One of the negative things was that even though they told us on arrival that they had to refill the minibar, they did not do it and ask us to pay for drinks we did not have at check-out but on the good side, we did not have to argue to prove that we did not use the minibar and have the amount deleted from our account. Just waiting to check credit card statement. This error was not the ending to an excellent trip to Barcelona I would have wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andreas_M_K
Reviews.Content: Excellent from every aspect. Room: Not your typical european hotel room - relatively spacious and beatiful design. Personnel: Well-trained, friendly and always willing to help. Design: Modern (nice for me!!!) Location: Conveniently located for everything (sight-seeing, shopping, night time activities etc).

Reviews.Title: “Fab staff and location”
Reviews.Author: MsMidders
Reviews.Content: Have literally just got home after spending the weekend at the Mirror. This is a fantastic hotel in a great location. The staff couldn't be more helpful, friendly and smiley! We stayed in a privledge room on the 9th floor, not the biggest of rooms but an amazing terrace overlooking the Barcelona rooftops. We only had breakfast once in the hotel, a little pricey but lots of choice and again very friendly staff. All in all a great trip, I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel... Great location”
Reviews.Author: Benimalo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great location. Good breakfast and dinner. The only thing that it wasnt good is that the door of the bathroom is transparent. Great service

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: andypcb
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel. Amazing architecture and room design, friendly and efficient staff and a great location. We had their least expensive room, but were knocked out by the design and facilities. Fantastically comfy beds with superb linen, not one but 2 LCD TVs, with one in the toilet ( though channel choice not great ), brilliant multi-function shower, fluffy bathrooms and great box of toiletries and accessories. The buffet breakfast was excellent, with quality ingredients. We asked for an early check-in and the room was available at 1130. Location is a couple of blocks from Diagonal station at the top of Passeig de Gracia. Highly recommended and a definite for any future visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, unusual hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jen79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights, including New Years Eve. The location is brilliant (it's a bit of a walk from the more touristy areas - but is definitely walkable), it is a more residential area and feels really safe at night. There are loads of bars and restaurant's around, nearly all of them are full of locals so you feel like you're seeing some of the real Barcelona. The hotel staff were very helpful. The rooms are very comfortable, the bathroom set up is a bit weird - definitely a hotel you need to be comfortable with your travelling companion! The bed is really comfy, the air-con is a bit noisy and our neighbours slammed their doors which was really loud in our room. Overall it's a good hotel and, if you book it on one of the discounted hotel websites, is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,quality,contemporary”
Reviews.Author: Jonosmith
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful surprise when first seeing our room, quite breathtaking in its stunning clean white looks. Only small negative was noise from the central lobby during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and bright”
Reviews.Author: WendyDub
Reviews.Content: I just came from a 4 day stay at this hotel and can summarize as follows: Pro's: -Good neighbourhood but slightly away from the center(10-15 minute walk to the 1st metro stop). -Friendly staff who were helpful in giving their advice and assistance. -unique design, clean and bright rooms. Con's: -rooms are quite small so if you need space then opt for another hotel. -internet stopped working for the remaining 2 days and staff kept telling me that they will fix it but never got around to it until i checked out. -rates are expensive for what the hotel offers. All in all it was a good experience staying in this hotel, i think there are still some teething issues it needs to go through in terms of staff training going the way they are im confident they will get there, if you're looking to relax and go for long walks then this is the place, if you want to be in the hustle and bustle of Barcelona then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but is slipping in quality”
Reviews.Author: lofa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews and the location with respect to my work. As in previous reviews here, the space is very modern with an open plan kitchen. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed Sunday and Monday so I did not get to try the dinner here. Breakfast was a nice display of fruits and meats though I have seen better at the AC hotels in town. Where my great concern lies is in the quality of the materials used and the color selection. All white and beige looks great for a few months but then everything shows up on it and starts to look tacky. The white floors had several dark streaks on it, not dirt as much as marks from shoes and furniture. The room furniture is covered in mirrors and the lower corner of the sink cabinet had a broken piece of mirror missing. I was in two different rooms during this stay and both rooms had dark stains on the beige carpet under the bed. The cabinet door for the bar area you could push open but could not close, the wireless internet did not work in my room the two days I was there, one day it was for all floors the second day I was relocated to a room on the second floor where it worked. If it weren't for the friendliness of the staff and the fact that I had a good deal through the web, I would have reviewed this hotel more poorly but all in all, this place tries. I think they will have a hard time keeping up as it is not that old yet and already starting to show the cracks.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the new Mirror Hotel in Barcellona for eight days in June 2011. Sandwiched between two older buildings it i”
Reviews.Author: Maggieprill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Mirror Hotel in Barcellona for eight days in June 2011. Sandwiched between two older buildings it is a masterpiece of infill architecture. We enjoyed the design features, the friendly and helpful staff and the fact that it was in a pleasant area away from the touristy parts but still close to the important things we had gone to see. It boasts a Michelin 2 star restaurant which is excellent and reasonably priced.Maggie Prill Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: Design123
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful hotel, really friendly staff, throughly recommended. One minor issue, the 50% clear glass door on the bathroom (a bizarre trend in spanish hotel design!) will not be well received by many travellers.........

Reviews.Title: “Travel in stile”
Reviews.Author: MontrealAndrei
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodation, excellent location, helpful staff, free Wifi, close to transportation and main touristic spots (Sagrada, Casa Millo, etc.), in short a very pleasant 7 nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “On Reflection”
Reviews.Author: Cadigg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent if a little quirky. As another review stated the mirrors are everywhere it is a little like the hall of mirrors at the fair (without the distortions!) and everything else white, so quite clinical and clean... Very modern,flat screen TV opposite wall to toilet even! It is a little way out of Barcelona center but not far and took only maybe 3-4 mins to get to the main street into the center. Staff were helpful with a travel arrangements to Torres Vinyard and general getting about as this was our first visit. All in all I would recommend ....

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Stay”
Reviews.Author: Imaglobaltrotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, this was a beautifully kept hotel. The interior design was modern and clean, yet inviting. I enjoyed the sauna on the roof. Free internet was a nice addition. For the price we paid, we felt this accomodation was an excellent deal! The staff was friendly and helpful. We were able to get around easily, I loved the neighborhood this hotel is located in. There are mirrors all over the hotel, which is great if you like to look at yourself a lot :) All in all, I dont have a single compaint about this hotel. Its a nice 8-10 minute walk to the nearest subway. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “The Mirror”
Reviews.Author: chutrain
Reviews.Content: It's not too far from the posh areas of the Eixample neighborhood. But far enough where you don't feel like you're in tourist world. Located just off the Diagonal stop, it's pretty easy to get to anywhere in the city, provided you aren't afraid of public transit. The breakfast is good, has a wide selection, however it is continental breakfast and is quite pricey when not included as part of your stay. The rooms are super modern and well decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenna_2010
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel for my 25th Birthday weekend and we had a great time. The hotel is very clean and stylish and the bed is very comfy. The staff were friendly and polite and very willing to help with booking taxis and advising on general queries. We didn't have dinner or drinks in the restaurant/bar but we ordered breakfast room service one morning which was very expensive at 22 Euros per person but it was my birthday so that was our excuse! We were given a continental breakfast with LOTS of different pastries, rolls, cold meats and cheeses so you get what you pay for really. The only thing I would say is that the shower and toilet doors both have mirrored glass on them so you can see right through! Not advisable if you’re travelling with someone you don't know very well or on a business trip with a colleague as this could be very awkward indeed! We found it rather amusing so not a problem for us. Overall a great hotel in a good location (although next door is a strip club but there was never a problem with dodgy people hanging around!) and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: WinchesterGoose
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel and can only say good things about the hotel. Very friendly staff, nice and clean hotel (a bit too clean with all the white), maybe the only thing that isn't okay is the highly overpriced breakfast (22€ per person) while you can find very nice breakfast places within walking distance for half the money or less. The location is excellent, and not noisy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Design meets efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Divatripadvice
Reviews.Content: Although the first 15 minutes at the hotel would not be fit for a 2 star hotel, the rest of our stay was small luxury boutique hotel-esque. There is no parking available...really? Do you really expect me to drive around Barcelona to try to find parking? Valet parking was available nor was it offered. I was stressed and so was the front desk clerk who did not know how to deal with the situation. Anyway, after we got that settled, the rest was amazing. The standard room is small yet surprisingly well thought out. The layout is extremely practical, the bed is luxurious, and the mirrors very fun! They did not replenish amenities during our stay which made them seem a bit cheap. Do not miss the restaurants and its michelin star; it's on my top 10 best restaurant experience! In summary, it's great, could become divine if they figure out the small service details.

Reviews.Title: “no intimity at all”
Reviews.Author: albert m
Reviews.Content: The room we shared was smal, and there is no real bathroom : the washbasin is not separate from the room and is in front of the bed. The toilets and shower and toilet are separate and have doors, but transparent doors , and because of the conception of the room, you can't help seeing everything !!!!! The hotel service is not so bad, but everything is white, and the white ground is always dirty. The swimming pool is very small (looks like a jaccuzi rather than a swimming pool).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: shann0n9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. Everything was in walking distance. Some things were a far walk, but worth it because I go to see more of the city. The hotel itself was beautiful and the staff was friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms so comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: SheilaOS
Reviews.Content: Hotel very modern and unique! bed was so comfortable and front desk staff very helpful, bar not really somewhere you'd relax and have a drink but found hotel central enough for us ideal for quiet break and near enough to centre of barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Coolest decor ever!”
Reviews.Author: countryclubber
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Only open for 5 months. Great walking location to restaurants and shopping. The room was so cool we didn't want to leave. Front desk was helpful and friendly. Would love to stay there again and would certainly highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel-well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: blue323
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my sister..stunning hotel, fabulous decor. Staff were excellent, food in restaurant was divine. Its not located right in the tourist area though, but its location was a nice change as was beautiful and quiet yet with a lot of bars, restaurants (no niteclubs though!). Dont let that put you off as it was only 5euro in a taxi to Las Ramblas. Id highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel furbished in only white and mirrors”
Reviews.Author: jan_uit_vlaanderen
Reviews.Content: We rented the rooms through ebookers with a 50% discount. At a rate of average 120€/night this hotel's value for money is OK. Staff was friendly and fluent multilingual English/French. At reception we received a detailled map of Barcelona, which proved to be very usefull. The junior suite we had was clean, spacy although limited wardrobe space. Room is completely furbished in white and mirror just like the rest of the hotel. Airconditioning was quiet and good and coped easily with the heat. Room was cleaned every day and fresh towels every day, as well as an extended set of bathing amenities. The rooms are very modern and very specific trendy style. Check the hotel pictures to see if you like the all white, glass and mirrors style. The hotel is well situated close to the diagonal and Rambla Catalunya shopping streets and an ideal starting point for the "modernista" walk through Barcelona (Gaudi, Catafalch and Montaner buildings). Two of the most trendy restaurants of Barcelona are just around the corner (Igueldo and Osmosis). It's more at the border of the normal tourist areas - the old city and the old port. Which to me is an advantage, public transport in Barcelona is cheap and efficient. Staff is helpfull and friendly. Closest metro station is at 5 minutes. We did not take the breakfeast at the hotel (too expensive in my view). Around the corner on Rambly Catalunya is a Bopan bakery shop - where you can have similar quality breakfeast for 1/4th of the price.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: Shifu1
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel here on tripadvisor and let me say we glad we did!!! The white on white-glass- mirror decor was refreshing very modern upscale hotel. We stayed here for 1 day after our cruise, let me start our room was not ready which it was to be ready at 2:00 PM ( we arrived at 11:00 AM) so we understood, so they took our bags and locked them in a very safe room, and told us our room would be ready in 1 hour we said great, so we took this time to walk the area the front desk was very helpful and friendly to give us some tips on what to see in the area, let me say this is far from La rumbas which was good this hotel is in the inner city and we got see some great architecture. The hotel was only 4 blocks from the main area and great shopping. We got lost of course trying to find the hotel on the way back, and we finally found it about 2 hrs later, when we arrived back the room was ready and our bags were in the room already (GREAT SERVICE). Now mind you the hotel has only been opened at this time about 3 months which we did not know, they have a great breakfast included in the price (which I would take it) "YUMMY" they also have an espresso bar in the lobby. All I can say if you are looking for Great service not so far out of the way location (a train ride from major locations) sound proof rooms and super clean hotel "THIS IS THE PLACE"!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travelgeek83
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel in April for 4 nights. I cannot complement it enough. From the minute we checked in to the minute we left I have no complaints. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was amazing, and contrary to other reports we had no problems with cleanliness. The bed, bath, leather sofa for relaxing, shower, slippers and dressing gowns and two televisions all contributed to a perfect room. Never had a problem with the free wi-fi, was excellent knowing it was there to research things to do in the city. Everything is electronic but once you get the hang of this it is very easy and convenient to operate. Usually around 4pm we would venture up to the rooftop terrace for a swim in the sun. Having it to ourselves was simply perfection. I would not hesitate in returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - however some teething problems!”
Reviews.Author: zr1975
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Mirror hotel, Barcelona. Upon arrival - the hotel seemed amazing. In brilliant white & mirrors everywhere, it certainly stood out! Nothing was really explained upon check in... no mention of the breakfast times, internet usage etc. I assumed I would find all this in the rooms, and there was nothing there either (as I regular business traveller as myself - you would normally expect to see a hotel pack advising on the amenities). This had just a basic envelope pack consisting of hotel stationary only. Upon gaining access to my room, it became apparent quite quickly that there was an issue with the electrics in my room. I put the hotel card in to activate the room lights and they would remain on for about 5-10 seconds only then go out! I went down to reception & they said to call the chambermaid! The maid came up and re set the switch in the power unit in my room. It was good to go for a few minutes then the same happened again! I wanted to go out for a meal as by this time it was around 8.30pm, so I went out and hoped it would be resolved on my return. Once I returned there was still no electrics. I did become frustrated by now as the room for the 4 nights cost in excess of GBP 550.00, so to be honest I didnt feel I was getting value for money, plus I was tired and just wanted to shower and sleep (by now it was 11pm on night 1!!). The lady (the same one who asked me to call the chambermaid) on reception came up with me this time after she re set my actual room card. Still it didnt work and still I had the same "not bothered" attitude. She actually told me to worry about it in the morning! That night (as funny as it sounds), I washed my face with the light from my mobile phone! Comical really (or should I say it would of been had I of not been paying for this hotel room!!)... The next morning came and I went down to reception to try to resolves this issue - they assured me by the time I got back to my room that afternoon that the electrical issue would be resolved. At 4pm still NO electricity. I was fuming by now as I had been back and forth trying to resolve it and to no avail. The hotel Manager finally agreed to change my room (she referred to it as an upgrade) - however, it wasn't an upgrade at all. I was moved to the room next door which was only a standard double. Finally I had some electricity, so I wasnt too fussed about the room size at this point! The rooms itself are great in theory - very art deco... not really the place for a first romantic weekend away! - The toliet doors are see-through and face opposite the bed! Its basically all open planned - with the sink as you walk in the room (and not in the toilet itself). The bathroom is separate as is the tpolet and then the sink unit as I mentioned. The internet was another thing which crashed often and no information is given on this. I had to actually go to reception to request the password. It was things like this that were niggly and didn't add to a great experience. The breakfast service was interesting - just one lady covering the restaurant. She didnt really speak English (but then again, her English was much better than my Spanish!)... they could of done with an extra person in there to assist her. She wasnt attentive as she was running around to all tables. Not sure I would go there again. I think it was ok... but I wouldnt rush to visit again. Coming from a Customer Service background myself, I know what exceptional service entails and I have to say this fell far below that... issue resolution is not their strong point.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, well located design hotel - with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Dominika978
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the design. Everything is white (both in the common area and the room), and there are mirrors everywhere which gives an illusion of more space than there actually is. Staff was friendly and helpful, but laid-back, which I personally think is a good thing. We did not eat at the restaurant, but the place was packed thursday and friday evening, so it´s apparently very popular. When we entered the room, the first thing that hit us was "wow, this is cool". Huge (and very comfortable) bed, a flat screen tv in front of the bed and enough space to relax after a long day of walking around the city. There is a flat screen in the toilet too, which I thought was unnecessary. The toilet and the shower/tub are separate. Doors to toilet and shower are see through glass. That and the mirrors everywhere don´t really leave you ANY privacy. Because of that I would not recommend sharing a room if you´re traveling with someone you´re not 100% comfortable with. There are light switches/buttons on the wall, and on each side of the bed. You can choose to turn on/off the light in the entire room, or just parts of it. The room could have been cleaner, especially the tub, but it was better after the second day. The downside of the room is the shower. If you´re not careful, water leaks through the glass wall and on to the floor. The entire floor ended up flooded. The water temperature changed from warm to very hot many times during the shower (every day), which was weird. On day 3 the toilet started constantly flushing. We told the staff, and they fixed it, but it was the same the day after. Free WiFi worked fine. The flat screen is no use if you don´t understand spanish. No satellite, and not possible to rent movies. This it the first hotel I´ve been to that has a really good make up mirror with the right lighting. Bathroom amenities were ok, but not replaced when used. And we did not get any hand soap the entire stay, and had to use the shower gel. All in all a good hotel. Great design, good and central location in quiet neighborhood, nice staff and comfortable sleep. If it was not for the shower/toilet issues, I would rate this as an excellent hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - few niggles”
Reviews.Author: el21
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week long stay at this new hotel. First impressions not great. First front desk staff we encountered ignored us and we had to wait for someone else to help. There was a broken plastic step at front desk which was covered up by dirty rug. Considering this hotel just opened does not bode well for future. Room was spacious and had ample toiletries, although these were not always replenished. Glass doors on bathroom and shower room may be a problem for some. Bathrobes and slippers were welcome after hours of walking around city. Mirrors everywhere and lots of White padding on Walls. Nice design feature but not practical. The whiteness of the room was an issue. Already there was staining to the floors and Walls. Free wifi was good. Rooftop terrace and pool was tiny. 4 loungers and a couple of seats. Great if you get it to yourself - we enjoyed spending an hour relaxing after our day before heading out for dinner. The sauna wasn't opened yet. As others have mentioned cleaning was a bit hit and miss. First couple of days fine. Dirty bathmat which the cleaner had used to clean shower cubicle left on floor, towels and soap taken away and not replaced, bathrobes taken and not replaced. Expect bette from a new hotel billing itself as 4 star. Being a new hotel still issues with electricity and wifi. Electricity cut out a few times during our visit. Staff not too good at keeping us updated with what was happening. Chose this hotel based on it's Eco status. Except for solar panels helping with water heating, not too sure what else there is. No recycling in room, unfinished toiletries taken away. Small things that could make a big difference. Overall location was great. 5 minutes to metro. Supermarket along road to left of hotel. Great fish restaurant Marisco on same street as well as good pub on corner (Speakeasy) I liked the location of this hotel but still lots of work needed to make this hotel a real 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful interior design - great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: dodo1981
Reviews.Content: Newly opened hotel, in a quiet tree-lined street in the Eixample, close to Diagonal. Fantastic all-white immaculate design, in both hotel rooms and common area. The gourmet restaurant is the real star, food is very good and creative and service is accurate and friendly. Service at the reception and common areas is efficient and friendly as well. The hotel opened only a few weeks ago, and that may expain why there was no service list nor internal telephone list in my room, I felt a bit lost as I could not even call the reception, the number was not mentioned anywhere. Same applies to the code to enter the wireless network. One more remark is that there are just only a few international TV channels. All in all I would definitely reccommend this hotel, thanks to its good value for money, nice service, awesome design and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarthaV211
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three days after the hotel opened and aside from some rather annoying glitches with the electricity and Internet, this was a fabulous hotel. I assume they will work out the little kinks and without that, I would say this is one of the best foreign hotels I have stayed at. The hotel is small but beautiful and incredibly clean. The beds are huge and comfortable. The white walls and mirrors everywhere make it feel open even though it's small. The breakfast was delicious. The restaurant overall was amazing. And the staff was attentive and responsive. If I had a problem, they would be in my room within five minutes. I would definitely recommend this place and I would stay here the next time Im in Barcelona.
